caption: b"No matter what you're doing for Thanksgiving this year, we hope your day is a sweet one!\n\n#HappyThanksgiving"

b'Kenny Nichols, long-time dozer operator and Cat equipment owner, has dedicated his life to doing the work he loves. After climbing on a dozer for the first time at seven-years-old, he\xe2\x80\x99s spent the last 84 years logging over 110,000 hours operating dozers \xe2\x80\x94 making him one of the most experienced dozer operators around.

At 91 years old Kenny is still at it, and has no plans to retire anytime soon. "Why quit something you like doing?"

Read more about Kenny at cat.com/95. #LetsDoTheWork'

b'What does it take to recreate a giant game board in the dirt? Find out what machines and technology helped build our maze. 

Watch the full behind-the-scenes video at cat.com/trial9. 

#LetsDoTheWork #CatTrials'

b'Our GC products, like this 330 GC Hydraulic Excavator, are made for the cost-conscious customer who wants simple, best-in-class machines to do the work. See our News highlights to learn more about how our GC line of products is meeting needs from bustling cities to remote mine sites. #letsdothework'

b'Like you, our leaders have been navigating the unknown this year. Hear lessons in teamwork and adaptability in this newest podcast with Vice President Nigel Lewis. Listen on your favorite podcast app by searching for "The Caterpillar Podcast". #podcast'
b'Playing our version of PAC-MAN takes some real skills. Meet the people and players at cat.com/trial9. #CatTrials #PACMAN40th'

b'Dude, think you know the \xe2\x80\x9880s and \xe2\x80\x9890s? See how the last century came to a close for us and our customers with extraordinary infrastructure feats, major introductions and more in this video. Learn about at caterpillar.com/history #Caterpillar95'

b'Fabrication and welding brings it all together for Cat machines and the Cat Racing team. 

Watch more at www.cat.com/95. 

#LetsDoTheWork'

b'Building the larger than life sized maze for PAC-MAN:trade_mark: wasn\xe2\x80\x99t easy.  But our skilled operators, using machines with the latest technology, were up to the task. See what it took to build this iconic game in our behind-the-scenes videos at cat.com/trial9. #CatTrials PACMAN40th'

b"Thank you to our U.S. service members and families for all your sacrifices, including members of Team Caterpillar who have previously served.

We're proud to share that we've recently been recognized by @Forbes as a Top Employer for Veterans in 2020. Follow @wearecaterpillar for more on our commitment to hire veterans.

#HappyVeteransDay"

b'Ever wonder what it takes to build the Cat machines you see on construction sites, or how a race team gets a car ready for peak performance? Watch this behind the scenes look at how it happens.\n \nSee more at cat.com/racing. #LetsDoTheWork'

b"Caterpillar and your Cat dealer had your back during uncertain times. With 95 years of experience, we've learned to weather tough times. Count on us to help you succeed right now. We have your back today, tomorrow and moving forward. www.cat.com/95 \n\n#LetsDoThe Work"

b"Here's a DW21 wheel tractor-scraper that helped build the St. Lawrence Seaway \xe2\x80\x93 a series of locks, canals and channels that permits oceangoing vessels to travel from the Atlantic Ocean to the Great Lakes. More than 3,000 Cat machines helped in construction on the dam which began in the mid-1950\xe2\x80\x99s. \n\nThis year marks 70 years of the scraper and we're proud of how our customers have used it for decades to make infrastructure improvements, like the seaway. #LetsDoTheWork #TBT #construction #caterpillar95"

b"Don't let dodgy soil conditions slow you down on the job. @Morooka_USA's rubber-tracked carriers\xe2\x80\x94featuring the Cat C7.1 industrial engine\xe2\x80\x94are made for the worst ground conditions out there. Oh, and did we mention these also make a pretty great complement to your fleet of Cat machines?\n\nDiscover what else these dynamic dirt surfers do that other machines don't in today's Insta story. #PoweredByCat"
b'Happy Halloween from all of us at Caterpillar! How are you celebrating?\n\n:camera:: @laurwhitfield'

b"Can't get enough of Cat Trial 9: PAC-MAN:trade_mark:? Shop our new collection of PAC-MAN merchandise on shopcaterpillar.com. And for a chance to win some of the items from the collection, head over to our Facebook to enter to win.\n\n#LetsDoTheWork #CatTrials #PACMAN40th @shopcaterpillar"

b'Here are a few photos from our Archives! This first \xe2\x80\x9cgem\xe2\x80\x9d of a photo captures a 1951 visit from international radio and TV star Gene Autry. (Gene\xe2\x80\x99s in the middle with the white cowboy hat, of course.) Autry was said to have climbed into the "saddle" of a Cat D6 and yelled \xe2\x80\x9cHeigh-Ho, Caterpillar"! The Archives is also host to the Caterpillar Ten and thousands more items, including photos and equipment - all representing the legacy of our people and products.  #ArchivesMonth'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s #WallpaperWednesday and this week we\xe2\x80\x99re sharing a special Cat Trial 9: PAC-MAN edition. Check out our stories to screenshot and save, and see more wallpapers in our profile highlights. #LetsDoTheWork #CatTrials #PACMAN40th'

b'Sure, you can spend your internship filing papers and fetching coffee. Or you can become an intern at Caterpillar and do actual work on actual projects that actually matter. You might even be able to participate in one of the #CatTrials, like Madison. Check out @wearecaterpillar and follow them to learn more about our team and career opportunities! #iAmCaterpillar #LetsDoTheWork'

b"Watch an epic tug of war \xe2\x80\x94 pitting one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s strongest men against one of the world's most iconic machines.\n\nSee more of the #CatTrials before the next one launches: www.cat.com/trial9"

b'#SWEEPSTAKES! We\xe2\x80\x99ll be cheering on @tyler_reddick and the #CatRacing team at @kansasspeedway tomorrow.  In honor of the race we\xe2\x80\x99re giving away (10) 1:24 Scale Models of the No. 8 Caterpillar Chevrolet.

To Enter: Tag a friend in the comments.

Open to U.S. residents 18 years and older only. Entries accepted through 11:59 pm CT on 10/18/20. Ten (10) winners will be randomly drawn by 10/20/20 and notified by DM within 72 hours. Complete rules and conditions are linked in profile. #LetsDoTheWork'

b'Brutal temperatures. Blazing sunshine. Hazards unlike any other. Two Japanese golf pros take the sport to a whole new level as they tackle a course made entirely of moving Cat equipment. 

See more #CatTrials: www.cat.com/trial9. 

#LetsDoTheWork'

b"How far out were the '70s?! We think they were pretty awesome. We loved introducing our customers to the massive new D10 and seeing origins of our remanufacturing story. Enjoy some highlights from the 1970s in this video. Can you dig it? #Caterpillar95 #LetsDoTheWork"

b'What do you get when you set a fleet of Cat equipment, operators and sculptors loose in a giant sandbox? A work of art, a world record \xe2\x80\x94 and proof that with Cat power and precision, you can build anything you imagine.

Watch more #CatTrials: cat.com/trial9. 

#LetsDoTheWork'

b"What happens when you let a Cat machine loose in a china shop? Not what you'd expect. Take a look back at one of our original #CatTrials to watch a 301.7 CR Mini Excavator maneuver through the aisles with the poise of a matador.\n\nWatch more videos from our Trials series: cat.com/trial9. #LetsDoTheWork"

b'We\'re all sharing a ride on the roller coaster that is 2020. We asked Vice President Joe Creed, licensed psychologist Dr. John Pompe and Holt Cat President and Chief Administrative Officer Corrina Holt to share their experiences and lessons learned. To hear what they had to say, search for "The Caterpillar Podcast" in your favorite podcast app or find the link in our "News" highlights. #WeAreCaterpillar #podcast'

b"Get to know: @fattruck_industrial. This Cat C2.2 powered monster of a machine makes off-road hazards likes water, sludge, mountains and boulders look like child\xe2\x80\x99s play \xe2\x80\x94 all while transporting up to 8 people to some of the world's most remote sites. Want to see more? Check out the link in our stories. #PoweredByCat"

b"Gigantic Jenga. Tug-o-War with a Mountain. Two Guinness World Records. From Rio de Janeiro to a Chinese mountain side, you've seen our products and services accomplish some incredible feats. Stay tuned for what's next: cat.com/trial9. #CatTrials #LetsDoTheWork"

b"At Caterpillar, we proudly support the advancement of modern manufacturing each and every day. In honor of #MFGDay20, No. 8 Driver @tyler_reddick spoke with a few team members from our small dozer production team. They're just a few of the 253 who will have their names appear on the special paint scheme during this weekend's race. #LetsDoTheWork #CatRacing"

b"Happy Manufacturing Day! How have we remained a leader in the industry for the past 90 years? It\xe2\x80\x99s simple: we have the best people getting the work done. \n\nOur employees around the globe work daily to produce quality products through quality work. They play a vital role in building the world\xe2\x80\x99s infrastructure - the small, the big, and everything in between. Their commitment to doing the work, putting in the time and getting the job done is the heart and soul of everything we do at Caterpillar. #iAmCaterpillar #Let'sDoTheWork @wearecaterpillar"

b'Interested in how to lead a new team (think 90 days of listening) or lessons in workplace safety? The Caterpillar Podcast is for you! In celebration of International Podcast Day, host of the Caterpillar Podcast, Rusty Dunn, shares his favorite moments captured behind the mic. Head to the link in bio to check them out. #iAmCaterpillar #internationalpodcastday #LetsDoTheWork #podcast'

b"What's orange on the outside but yellow on the inside? The Cat powered @SullivanPalatek air compressor, that's what. :winking_face:  Thanks to the powerful, compact engine, this machine makes drilling and demoing on jobsites a blast. :collision:  Check out our Stories for a link to read more. #PoweredByCat"

b"Tune in to today's race on NBCSN at 7:00 p.m. ET to see our special Cat Mining scheme. And follow Cat Mining on Facebook and Twitter for behind-the-scenes videos with @TylerReddick and the @rcrracing team, downloads and live updates. Visit cat.com/mining for more.\n\n#LetsDoTheWork #CatRacing #Mining #NASCAR"

b'For @Turner_Mining_Group, dealer support is everything. \xe2\x80\x9cAll I care about is who\xe2\x80\x99s going to be there when it\xe2\x80\x99s down. We got the warm and fuzzy feeling from @cartermachinery, and I think it was that decision that helped catapult us to the next phase of growth.\xe2\x80\x9d - @keatonsturner.\n\nSee more on Turner at https://bit.ly/3kUazTj #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95'

b'The construction, mining, quarry and oil industries have among of the highest rates of suicide in the U.S. Michelle Walker is on a mission to change that. \xe2\x80\x9cWe need to equate mental health with physical health,\xe2\x80\x9d she says. \xe2\x80\x9cI envision an industry where a worker will feel just as safe saying, \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99m having trouble,\xe2\x80\x99 as in getting a spot on the arm checked for skin cancer.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nCheck out our bio :link: for more on Michelle and the Construction Industry Alliance for Suicide Prevention (@the_ciasp). #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95 #suicidepreventionmonth #SeptemberSTANDup'

b'In this episode of Beyond the Iron, we sit down with Fred Rio - the global product manager for our Construction Digital & technology team. Fred brings a unique perspective to his role, including a positive outlook and forward-looking style... important characteristics in an intensely challenging year. Listen as he talks about how they\'re working to solve customer problems by leveraging expertise in both the digital and the construction realms. And, encourages leaders to share hope with their teams. \n\nYou can find this newest "Beyond the Iron" podcast on your favorite podcast app! #podcast #construction #digital #LetsDoTheWork'

b'Seven years ago, the Caterpillar Foundation set an ambitious goal to help 50 million people out of poverty by 2020. They worked with organizations like @charitywater, @livinglandsandwaters, and @iyfsnaps to help them reach that goal. Find out how \xe2\x80\x94 visit our bio :link: for the story. #Caterpillar95'

b"There's nothing like the first scoop of dirt with a new machine :smirking_face: Here's @rjl.excavating's new 259D3 working on custom home site at the base of Pinnacle Peak Mountain in Estancia, Arizona.

What new Cat machines are you breaking in on your jobsites?

#LetsDoTheWork"

b"Here's the first Cat No. 583 pipelayer being introduced to the public in Los Angeles in 1955! Today's pipelayer - and the operators who use them - are equally impressive. Designed by Caterpillar specifically for pipeline applications, today an operator can look through expansive glass surfaces that allow for unhindered visibility around the machine and into the trench. Scroll through the images for more about this amazing machine and visit cat.com for machine details. #LetsDoTheWork"

b'This was Cat Brand Week here at Caterpillar.  It\xe2\x80\x99s something we do every year to celebrate our yellow pride.  This year was a bit different with so many of us working at home, but it was still a great celebration. Just proof that no matter where we are, Team Caterpillar is strong and ready to get the job done. #LetsDoTheWork'

b'In 1969, we supplied power to the Apollo 11 mission to the moon. How\'s that for "far out"? See more 1960s highlights in this video, and learn more about our history at caterpillar.com/history. #Caterpillar95 #TBT #LetsDoTheWork'

b"The US West Coast is going through a really tough time right now. And that's an understatement. We're inspired by those who jumped in to help and put their communities first. 

The firefighters, the first responders, we appreciate you.

We also want to thank our customers who brought in their dozers to clear the land to help stop the fires. And our dealers that have been providing round-the-clock support. Here are a few pictures our customers and dealers shared with us. Incredible."

b'From using social media as a recruiting tool to building a fun and engaged company culture, @turner_mining_group is doing things differently when it comes to attracting (and keeping) Millennials and Gen Zers. #LetsDoTheWork https://bit.ly/3koMYK9'

b'One of the biggest challenges in the dirt-moving business is finding equipment that can handle tough job sites with less-than-ideal underfoot conditions\xe2\x80\x94terrains that are too soft for heavy machines. In 2009, @mobiletracksolutions began developing high-quality, construction-grade earthmoving solutions. They used integrated Cat engines in other equipment models, so when it came time to upgrade their 3630T and 3630W with new engines, the Cat brand was the logical choice.

They worked with Cat dealers from concept to completion to find the best fit for their heavy-duty construction-grade tractors and landed on the 630 hp, 18-liter C18.

\xe2\x80\x9cWhen you run our MTS construction tractors with the C18 engine, you get the wow effect.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 John P. Moyna, owner of MTS. Visit our bio :link: to learn more.

#PoweredByCat #LetsDoTheWork'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s race weekend! The No. 8 Cat Rental Store Chevrolet is ready for its night under the lights at @RichmondRaceway. Check out the @the_cat_rental_store Facebook page for a Behind-the Scenes tour of the race hauler and Q&A with the No. 8 Chevrolet spotter before it hits the track at 7:30 p.m. ET on NBCSN! #CatRacing'

b'Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s @RichmondRaceway, with its \xe2\x80\x9cD\xe2\x80\x9d shaped oval track, is considered iconic by many race fans. So when the team at Donley\xe2\x80\x99s Concrete Group had the chance to work on the infield expansion, they knew they had to be part of it. Donley worked on the concrete services portion of the venture, with support from @the_cat_rental_store and local Cat dealer @cartermachinery.

For the team at Donley's, working on the project meant tackling new challenges to coordinate a range of requirements needed to create the new fan experience. \xe2\x80\x9cThere's about 100,000 square feet of concrete slab for the infield entertainment areas,\xe2\x80\x9d said David Coleman, Project Controls Manager for Donley. \xe2\x80\x9cThis was a unique challenge to build, as it needed to be within strict tolerances to allow race cars to travel over the slab to winners circle and allow race fans an up close and personal relationship with the race.\xe2\x80\x9d

The Cat Rental Store was a major player in helping Donley's get the work done, supplying everything from generators, wheel loaders, soil compactors, skid steers, and mini excavators to light plants and plate compactors. "It\xe2\x80\x99s a great relationship to have with Caterpillar when we can call our dealer and say \xe2\x80\x98something just came up, I need this equipment yesterday, and gone tomorrow\xe2\x80\x99," Coleman said.

See more \xe2\x80\x94 visit our bio :link: for the story. #LetsDoTheWork #caterpillar95'

b"Back to school may look a little different, but that doesn't mean you can't start the year off in style. :smiling_face_with_sunglasses:

Wishing everyone a fun and safe return to school!

#LetsDoTheWork (:camera: : @aumanbrittany & @andrewforephoto"

b'Like many solutions, it started as a simple pencil sketch. Our engineers spent over a year on the road, in the air and at sea talking to marine architects and customers to develop the Cat Tier 4 marine engine. They boarded more than 50 vessels at dozens of shipyards worldwide. It was during one of these visits that engineer Rick Jeffs quickly sketched out an idea on a napkin. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was a direct result of feedback we received from naval architects."

The design evolved over the course of the next few months, but the basic concept remained the same. In May 2014, we brought our Tier 4 Final and IMO Tier III marine solution to the market.

Read more about the process to bring this engine from sketch to shipyard at the :link: in our bio. #Caterpillar95 #iAmCaterpillar'
b'We know you work hard \xe2\x80\x94 building, powering and shaping our world to make it better for all of us. Today we celebrate you. Happy Labor Day!'

b"We're celebrating 35 years of the Cat Certified Rebuild program. Watch how our Cat dealer technicians transform a D7R with 11,300 hours from working in tough pipeline construction into a 0-hour, like new machine. Read more about the program's milestone at cat.com/95 and visit cat.com/rebuild to learn more. #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95"

b"Here's a fun #FBF to the 1950s! Like today, our customers\xe2\x80\x99 projects in the \xe2\x80\x9950s demanded tough equipment that came with superior, localized service. It was a demand that we were prepared to meet with existing offerings plus new equipment like our first self-propelled wheel tractor-scraper, the D9 and the No.6 shovel. See more about the decade at: caterpillar.com/history #Caterpillar95"

b'To celebrate #WorldPhotographyDay we\xe2\x80\x99re sharing a few favorites images from Caterpillar Photographer Nick Pflederer. In his 10 year career, @pflederer has traveled to 25 different countries photographing everything from Cat small portable generators to a 400-ton (363 tonne) 797 Mining Truck. If a picture is worth a thousand words, Nick could fill up a library with the stories captured in his photos. Take a look at some of his favorites and check out the link in our stories to read more about them. #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95'

The No. 8 car is showing off the Cat App \xe2\x80\x94 a simple, easy-to-use fleet management tool that makes your equipment easy to track, with real-time access to data and actionable insights. #LetsDoTheWork #NASCAR #CatRacing'

View our story today for a link to listen. Or, search for "Beyond the Iron" using your favorite podcast app. #podcast \n#LetsDoTheWork #safetytip'
b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve rounded up some new mobile wallpapers in our Stories! Check it out and head to our story highlights to see even more. #LetsDoTheWork'

b'This postcard from the early 1900s shows a customer in Western Canada plowing with a Holt Caterpillar engine. We\xe2\x80\x99ve been proudly supporting our Canadian customers, along with Cat:registered: dealers Finning Canada and Toromont Cat, since way back then. Explore more of our history at caterpillar.com/history. #LetsDoTheWork #Archives #Caterpillar95 #Canada'

b"Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s on the track or moving dirt, success has a lot to do with training. #CatRacing driver @TylerReddick recently experienced that when he used racing simulators to stay sharp when he couldn't go to the track. Machine operators can use similar technology in Cat Simulators.\n\nWhile nothing can replace stick time in a real machine, our simulators offer a great way to get started \xe2\x80\x94 whether it\xe2\x80\x99s introducing a new operator to the controls or giving an experienced operator the opportunity to refine skills. Visit cat.com/95 for more. #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95"

b"The fully overhauled, next generation 6060 Hydraulic Mining Shovel is more durable and nearly 30 tons heavier than legacy machines, which translates into longer service life and better performance. Thanks to collaboration between our team and our customers who know mining best, the next generation 6060 is ready for the next era of mining and will work harder and last longer. Find out how our customer's input helped in the redesign of the 6060 at caterpillar.com/annualreport. #LetsDoTheWork"

b'For over 45 years, we\xe2\x80\x99ve given end-of-life products a rebirth through the sustainable practice called remanufacturing. Believe it or not, this process starts well before the product is nearing its final days. Engineers use design guidelines to build key products with remanufacturing in mind. When a component reaches the end of its initial serviceable life, dealers return the used component, referred to as core, to us. Then, our Reman team gets to work cleaning, inspecting and remanufacturing it to its original factory specifications. In doing so, we reduce waste and minimize the need for the raw material, energy and water required to produce new parts. Sustainability is a core part of our company. Follow @wearecaterpillar to find out how to join the team that builds (and rebuilds) what matters. #iAmCaterpillar'

b'Check out this video looking at Caterpillar in the 1940s! In the mid-40s, we introduced the first company-designed-and-built bulldozer blade and the first company-designed-and-built pull-type scraper. Just like today, our products helped customers complete major infrastructure projects like highways and dams around the world. Learn more: caterpillar.com/history #caterpillar95'

b'Check out this medium track-type tractor! It was one of three special edition tractors made to commemorate the 175,000 MTTT high drive production milestone.

Introduced in 1985, the MTTT meant improved durability and ease of service of the powertrain components for our customers. The medium tractors also took advantage of one additional high drive benefit \xe2\x80\x93 the ability to extend the tracks forward or rearward to optimize tractor balance for unique applications. See the link in our bio for more about the milestone. 
 
#LetsDoTheWork'
b'When #NationalTattooDay meets #WorldEmojiDay.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s Wednesday and we\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating with a fresh batch of phone wallpapers available in our stories! What else would you like to see for upcoming wallpapers? Drop your suggestions in a comment :backhand_index_pointing_down: and check out our wallpaper highlights for even more! #LetsDoTheWork #WallpaperWednesday'
b'Wishing our U.S. fans a Happy 4th of July!\n\n#LetsDoTheWork #4thofJuly #Fireworks'

b"#SWEEPSTAKES! We\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating 95 years in business \xe2\x80\x94 and 95 years of customers doing the work \xe2\x80\x94 with a year of giveaways. Throughout our anniversary year we\xe2\x80\x99re giving away different prizes to help you show off your Cat pride. This month, we're giving away a Cat pressure washer, 4 pairs of Cat gloves and 20 special edition anniversary Cat hats. Visit cat.com/95 to enter to win! #Caterpillar95"

b'What does it look like to lead by example? True safety leadership goes beyond wearing proper PPE and ensuring others do the same. Join us tomorrow LIVE on Facebook and YouTube to hear from Caterpillar Safety Expert Justin Ganschow as he shares how to: - Understand the elements of a strong safety culture
- Use accountability to drive safety
- Reinforce desired outcomes with positive recognition

Learn more at cat.com/safetyleadership. #LetsDoTheWork #SafetyLeadership #SafetyCulture'

b'During our latest Beyond Safety Basics webinar Abby Fansler shared how safety communication strategies influence employee behavior and help build a positive safety culture. Her tips included reinforcing safe behaviors with positive recognition, taking the time to ask employees \xe2\x80\x9cwhat are we doing right?\xe2\x80\x9d and recognizing employees that take personal accountability for safety. Watch the webinar recording at cat.com/safetyleadership. #LetsDoTheWork #SafetyLeadership'

b"Check out the Caterpillar Diesel Seventy-Fives pulling scrapers on the north of Grand Coulee Dam in 1935!

For contractors in the 1930s, our machines were top choice for power, stamina, and low operating and maintenance costs. 
For us, the 1930s saw our company on a path of innovation, customer commitment and industry leadership \xe2\x80\x93 things that are still in our DNA today. Check our story today to see more of our machines at work around the world in the '30s. #Caterpillar95 #LetsDoTheWork"

b'What leaders do and say influences the beliefs and behaviors of people around them. Mastering these skills will help you create a safer workplace. Join our webinar to:

1) Understand how your words and actions influence others (as a leader with or without a title)
2) Learn how communication fits into safety culture
3) Leave with tactical strategies for effective communication

Join us LIVE on Facebook or YouTube to hear from Caterpillar Safety Services expert Abby Fansler.

Visit cat.com/safetyleadership for the full schedule. #LetsDoTheWork'
b"To all the dad's who inspire the next generation of builders, fixers, doers and creators. Happy #FathersDay."

b'As many of our customers around the world are getting back to work, the China Basketball Association is getting back on the court with games starting June 20th. Beijing Royal Fighters coach and former NBA/CBA star @starburymarbury says for players, it\xe2\x80\x99s all about mental and physical preparation.\n\nIt\xe2\x80\x99s no different for our customers when it comes to safety. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99re launching an educational webinar series on safety with a focus on physical and mental health. See the schedule at cat.com/safetyleadership. #LetsDoTheWork #ChinaBasketball'

b'In the age of analytics, quality data is a game changer. We see it with our #CatRacing team, who uses it to improve their results on the track. And our customers use data from Cat machines to make their job sites more productive and to make better equipment management decisions. Our fleet management quiz will show you what good data can mean for your business. Check out our Stories for the link. #LetsDoTheWork'

b'As COVID-19 began to affect people across the country, the company behind Cat Workwear ramped up production of masks for those in need. After delivering 15,000 to local medical workers they received an order for 250,000 to support Caterpillar employees at work, and those who would soon return. \xe2\x80\x9cWe were able to use our company\xe2\x80\x99s values to be nimble and find a solution to an urgent need that was there and that\xe2\x80\x99s kind of how we got behind it. It was our supply chain, our freight forwarder, people in the office breaking shipments down into smaller packers for delivery. Everyone was pitching in.\xe2\x80\x9d See more at cat.com/95. #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95'

b"This month we're launching a free webinar series on safety psychology, human behavior, #leadership and #mentalhealth on the jobsite.

Join us June 16 on Facebook or YouTube for a presentation and live Q&A with Jenny Krasny from Caterpillar Safety Services.

During this #webinar we\xe2\x80\x99re talking about the psychology of safety and understanding why people behave the way they do, especially in uncertain or stressful circumstances. Find out: - Why do people take unnecessary risks on the job?
- Why don\xe2\x80\x99t they speak up when they feel unsafe?
- How can you support your employees and coworkers during stressful, uncertain times?

Visit cat.com/safetyleadership for the full schedule. #LetsDoTheWork"

b"Check out the fan-favorite dozer! Our dozers have worked on some of the modern world\xe2\x80\x99s greatest engineering projects, including the U.S. Interstate Highway System, the Three Gorges Dam in China, and the widening of the Panama Canal, just to name a few. This year we're celebrating the 75th anniversary of dozer blade."

b'Many hospitals have veered into uncharted territory during the COVID-19 pandemic, requiring them to operate differently to limit virus spread, while also still caring for patients. For many Atlanta hospitals, that new way of working now includes tents. Lots of them.

This isn\xe2\x80\x99t your typical camping or tailgating tent set up; these tents need plenty of power for lights, medical equipment and AC to ensure patients and staff are both safe and comfortable. For Cat Dealer @yanceypowersystems, it\xe2\x80\x99s been an opportunity to step up and help local hospitals adapt to a new way of working.

From the very beginning, the Yancey team considered every detail of the medical tent set up: the exact equipment and generators required, the equipment set up as well as the type of generator power required to ensure the sites could stay up and running without interruption. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s about taking care of the customer, and that\xe2\x80\x99s ingrained in our culture. It\xe2\x80\x99s really about follow-up, follow through, and truly caring during this time when lives are on the line,\xe2\x80\x9d said Drew Eckford, Yancey Rental Power manager.

See more at cat.com/95. #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95'

b'We stand with those who are fighting against racism and injustice in our communities. Everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect and have access to equal justice. To support this, the Caterpillar Foundation will donate to an organization that will be announced soon. To read our CEO\xe2\x80\x99s message, see the link in our bio.'

b"We just hit a huge milestone! Our fleet of autonomous haul trucks (the largest in the world) have safely hauled 2 billion tonnes in just over six years. :clapping_hands:Our trucks use Cat MineStar Command for hauling \xe2\x80\x94 a technology that's all about safety, considering every movement, reducing waste and making miners' work more repeatable. \nWe're proud to be a global leader in providing solutions to help our customers build a better world. Visit caterpillar.com for more on this technology and milestone."

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s time to hit the books \xe2\x80\x93 we\xe2\x80\x99re offering FREE access to Caterpillar University through the end of June. You\xe2\x80\x99ll have access to over 250 online courses that can help your business, with classes on everything from safety to machine operation and more. Visit caterpillaruniversity.com to get started. #LetsDoTheWork'

b'It was a scene watched by people around the world \xe2\x80\x94 four @mcallistertowing tugboats, surrounded by the Coast Guard, escorting the USNS Comfort hospital ship into NYC harbor. Meet the team that made it happen at cat.com/95 (linked in profile). #Caterpillar95'

b"We're celebrating 95 years and taking a look back at our company through the decades. This video is all about the 1920s - an era marked for us by great change. But just like now, the focus was on supporting our customers and creating products that would help get the job done. Learn more at link in bio. #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95 #Archives"

b"There's just something about #CatYellow against a bright blue sky that gives us all the :smiling_face_with_heart-eyes::smiling_face_with_heart-eyes::smiling_face_with_heart-eyes: :camera:: @betonnet_gmbh | #LetsDoTheWork"

b'As we continue telling 95 stories of good, we chose number 5 on our list as a thank you. Not just to our customers who continue to build towards a better tomorrow, but to people everywhere who are digging in, working hard and giving us hope. See more at cat.com/95. #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95'

b'We salute customers stepping up in this time of crisis. Based out of Pella, Iowa, @vermeercorp manufactures industrial and agricultural equipment, many powered by Cat engines. With their local hospital in short supply of PPE, Vermeer shifted their work to use 3D printing to create visor pieces for face shields. In addition to involving employees in this work, they also worked with area students to 3D print the visor pieces at home.\n\nSee more stories at cat.com/95. #LetsDoTheWork #Caterpillar95'

b"To celebrate our 95th anniversary, we're telling 95 stories of good from around the world. No. 31 on the list comes from the #CatRacing team.

All around the world people and businesses are shifting gears. The on-track #NASCAR season may be postponed, but the races continue in the iRacing Pro series where we're sponsoring the No. 31 car. And for our customers and Cat dealers, many of them are working around the clock to support critical health and infrastructure needs. From Seattle, to Southern California and Florida our dealers and customers are powering hospitals and medical facilities.

At Caterpillar, we continue to salute those who continue to keep the world moving in these trying times. 
See more 95 stories for good at cat.com/95. #LetsDoTheWork #95StoriesForGood #Caterpillar95"

b'Our work environments might look a little different these days, but that won\xe2\x80\x99t stop Team Caterpillar from celebrating #NationalBringYourChildToWorkDay! Follow @wearecaterpillar to see how our team is spending their day teaching the next generation of world builders. #LetsDoTheWork'

b"Check out this Repower locomotive from Progress Rail, a Caterpillar company! By replacing old, inefficient engines, and antiquated control systems with new, state-of-the-art, clean technology, the next generation of single-engine locomotives can provide reliable service for decades. That's one of the ways we're putting sustainability into action.\n\nOn this #EarthDay2020, we're especially proud of our amazing team of engineers, makers, developers and many more who are creating solutions that help our customers. Learn more at link in bio. #LetsDoTheWork"

b'Thank you, Team Caterpillar - past and present - for contributing $3.9M, including the Caterpillar Foundation match, to help support our communities in their COVID-19 response efforts. Visit the link in bio to learn more about our efforts.  #iAmCaterpillar #LetsDoTheWork'

b'In honor of our 95th anniversary, we want to celebrate the people doing the work. You inspire us every day and we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to share your stories of good over the next year. See more at cat.com/95. \n#LetsDoTheWork #95StoriesForGood #Caterpillar95'

b"Today, we celebrate our 95-year anniversary. See our story today to get a glimpse into our past and download some new wallpaper for your phone! 
Our story really belongs to our team of people who have made our customers\xe2\x80\x99 work possible over the years. Together, we've seen incredible things: construction of 70,000+ U.S. highway miles, power supplied for the Apollo 11 moon mission, pipe laid for China\xe2\x80\x99s first oil pipeline, and so much more. 
Our customers today use more than 300 diverse products on various jobsites on all 7 continents. From trucking on ice roads to underground mining, they\xe2\x80\x99re making the world a better place. Now, new horizons await, and our customers will be the ones breaking the ground \xe2\x80\x93 and maybe even moving through space \xe2\x80\x93 to ensure all of our communities can thrive. 
#letsdothework #iAmCaterpillar #Caterpillar95"
b'Wishing a Happy Easter to all our peeps.\n\n#HappyEaster | :camera:: @gratoimages'

b"For Caterpillar Foundation President Asha Varghese, being born in India and growing up between her birthplace and rural Kentucky, has influenced her personally and professionally. Varghese leads a philanthropic organization with a nearly 70-year history of supporting global communities where Caterpillar employees live and work. \nIn this podcast, she talks about the Foundation's new strategy and focus, plus the power of collaboration. Find the link to her podcast in our bio."
